DOC.brief_summary: Patients with a displaced, shortened, midshaft clavicular fracture are randomized in two groups: conservative or operative treatment. The conservative arm is treated with a sling for 6 weeks. The operative arm is treated with osteosynthesis, within 2 weeks. Patients are clinically and radiologically evaluated during 1 year. A economical analysis is also done.
